text: In this video, we will show you
how to remove the SIM card in your phone.

The SIM card, or the subscriber
identification module,
allows a phone to be connected
to a specific carrier and a phone number.
You may need to remove your SIM card

if you are switching your
phone and adding a new one,

changing carriers, or if
your SIM card is damaged.
There are three sizes of SIM cards,
standard, nano, and micro.

Your phone will fit one
of these three sizes.

Note that the process of
removing your SIM card

will vary depending upon
your specific phone.

The SIM card is typically
located in one of two places,
under the back plate

or in a tray accessible from
the side edge of your phone.

We will show you how
to remove your SIM card
for both locations.
Make sure that you power off your phone

before you attempt to
change your SIM card.

On phones that have a
removable back plate,

the SIM card is likely
under that back plate.
If your phone has a replaceable battery,
you may have to remove the battery
to get to the SIM slot.
To access the SIM slot,
remove the back and look for a small tray.

Some SIM trays may have a little
movable cover, like a door.

Lift this cover and drop
the SIM card in place.
Replace the back cover
and power your phone back up.

If your phone doesn't
have a removable back,
then your SIM card is likely accessible

through a removable tray on
the side edge of your phone.
To pop out the tray,

use either a SIM-removal tool
that came with your phone
or simply a small paper clip.

Insert it into the tiny hole
next to the SIM tray slot

and gently push it in
until the tray pops out.
Pull out the SIM tray,
and if replacing the SIM card,

remove the old SIM card
and drop in the new one.

The tray is notched to
match the shape of the card,
so you can't put it in backwards.
Insert the tray back into the slot
and gently push it back in.
